meanings.definition: Of or relating to land or farming
meanings.sent1: The farmer's predial duties included tending to the crops and livestock.
meanings.sent2: The predial landscape was filled with fields of wheat and corn.
meanings.sent3: The predial chores kept the farmer busy from dawn till dusk.
meanings.sent4: Her predial knowledge of soil types was as deep as the roots of the oak tree.
meanings.sent5: The predial scent of freshly turned earth lingered in the air.

meanings.definition: A tax on land or property
meanings.sent1: The predial was due at the end of each harvest season.
meanings.sent2: The government imposed a predial to fund public services.
meanings.sent3: Paying the predial felt like giving a gift to the town hall.
meanings.sent4: The predial seemed to grow heavier with each passing year.
meanings.sent5: Avoiding the predial meant facing penalties and fines.
